docs.title: Impersonate [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Deception [Concentrate], [Language], [Physical], [Social], [Vocal]

By altering your voice, facial expressions, and even the way you sit or stand, you convincingly impersonate another person.

You can use Impersonate to trick someone into thinking you are someone else. If you have only verbal communication with your opponent, you can trick them with Impersonate alone. However, if you want to impersonate someone in the presence of others, you also need to use Disguise. If you got a Cool Success on your Disguise roll, lower the DL for Impersonate by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success They believe you and you gain an [Ally] Success They believe you Fade They believe you (but remain unsure) and they become [Suspicious] Glitch They don't believe you, their [Attitude] worsens, and they become [Confident]

docs.title: Avoid Crash [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [Physical], [Range], [Reaction], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

In a split second, you react to an oncoming hazard and swerve to avoid a crash.

When you are driving a [Vehicle] at [High Speed] and a sudden obstacle or hazard appears on the road ahead or if your vehicle [Crashes] for another reason, you can use a [Reaction] to use Avoid Crash. The [Handling] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Avoid Crash roll. If you use only [One Hand], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success You avoid the obstacle or hazard and are [Inspired] Success You avoid the obstacle or hazard Fade You avoid the obstacle or hazard (near miss) and you are [Shaken] Glitch Your [Vehicle] collides with the obstacle or hazard and [Crashes]

docs.title: Chase [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [Move], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

You spot the car you're chasing up ahead and rapidly accelerate to catch up.

When you use Chase, you identify a target [Vehicle] ahead of you ([Nearby] or [Far]). If the other [Vehicle] is traveling at [High Speed], you must do the same (which raises the DL by one). If the other [Vehicle] is [Far] away, raise the DL by one. The [Handling] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Chase roll. If you use only [One Hand], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success You [Move] [Close] to the other [Vehicle] and may overtake (get ahead) if desired Success You [Move] [Close] to the other [Vehicle] Fade You [Move][[Close](/../Keywords/Keyword_Close)] to the other [Vehicle] and you are [Distracted] Glitch You fall behind and are [Distracted] and the other [Vehicle] may use Escape

docs.title: Escape [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [Move], [Physical], [Reaction], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

When your opponent falls behind, you seize the opportunity and drive your car out of sight to lose them completely.

When you are driving a [Vehicle] that's the target of a Chase and your opponent falls behind, you may use a [Reaction] to Escape. The [Handling] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Escape roll. If you use only [One Hand], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success You get away, the chase ends, and you are [Inspired] Success You get away and the chase ends Fade You get away, the chase ends, and your [Vehicle] takes 3 damage Glitch Your [Vehicle] takes 3 damage and the other [Vehicle] is [Close] behind you

docs.title: Sideswipe [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Drive [Attack], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

You pull up alongside another driver and then violently swerve into them, damaging both of your vehicles.

To use Sideswipe, your [Vehicle] must be [Close] to the other [Vehicle]. The [Handling] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Sideswipe roll. If you use only [One Hand], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success Their [Vehicle] takes 20 damage and the other driver is [Shaken] Success Their [Vehicle] takes 15 damage and yours takes 5 damage Fade Both your and their [Vehicle] take 10 damage Glitch You miss them, your [Vehicle] takes 10 damage, and you are [Shaken]

docs.title: Driving Stunt [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [Physical], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

When you're behind the wheel, you are capable of pulling off daring high-speed stunts that threaten to break the laws of physics.

To use this trick, you must be driving a [Vehicle] at [High Speed] (but this does not raise the DL as it normally would). When you use Driving Stunt, state your desired outcome, such as I want to jump the draw bridge while it's opening or I want to tilt my car so it's almost on its side and I can go through a narrow alley. If you only use [One Hand] with Driving Stunt, raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success You get the desired outcome and you are [Lucky] Success You get the desired outcome Fade You get the desired outcome but your [Vehicle] takes 5 damage Glitch You lose control of your [Vehicle] and it [Crashes]

docs.title: Pit Maneuver [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Target Vehicle's [Stability] Drive [Attack], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Vehicle], [Visual]

Pit Maneuver is an aggressive driving move designed to disable your opponent's vehicle and bring it to a stop.

To use Pit Maneuver, your [Vehicle] must be [Close] to the other [Vehicle]. The [Handling] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Pit Maneuver roll. If you use only [One Hand], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success Their [Vehicle] [Crashes] Success Their [Vehicle] takes 10 damage, spins out, and stops Fade Both your and their [Vehicle] take 10 damage, spin out, and stop Glitch You miss and they [Move][[Far](/../Keywords/Keyword_Far)] away

docs.title: Pit Maneuver Sidebar
docs.text: You maneuver your vehicle alongside so your front is lined up with the other vehicle's rear end. Then you use your vehicle to strike the rear quarter panel of the other vehicle with the intent of causing it to spin out and for the other driver to lose control.

docs.title: Burst Fire [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [Gun], [Attack], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Visual]

You grip your weapon and issue a three-round burst.

When you use Burst Fire, your target must be at the [Optimal Range] for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. You may use [Spray] to hit an additional target. If you use [One Hand], raise the DL by one. Use your weapon's Burst Fire [Damage Array] with this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Maximum Damage] and they are [Suppressed] Success Choose to either deal [Normal Damage] or make them [Suppressed] Fade You deal [Minimum Damage] and they gain a [Combat Opportunity] Glitch Out of ammo. Spend 1 AP to use this weapon again.

docs.title: Full Auto [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Severe (26) Firearms [Attack], [Gun], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Range], [Visual]

You hold the trigger and lay down a continuous stream of hot lead.

When you use Full Auto, your target must be at the [Optimal Range] for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. You may use [Spray] to hit up to four additional targets (five total). Use your weapon's Full Auto [Damage Array] with this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Maximum Damage] and they are [Suppressed] Success You deal [Normal Damage] and they are [Suppressed] Fade You deal [Minimum Damage], they are [Suppressed], your weapon is [Out of Ammo] Glitch Your weapon is [Out of Ammo]

docs.title: Single Shot [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Firearms [Attack], [Gun], [Move], [One Hand], [Physical], [Range], [Visual]

You point your gun and shoot.

When you use Single Shot, your target must be at the optimal range listed for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. If you use [Two Hands], lower the DL by one. Use your weapon's Single Shot [Damage Array] with this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success Choose to deal [Maximum Damage] or deal [Normal Damage] and make a free [Move] Success You deal [Normal Damage] Fade You deal [Minimum Damage] and your opponent gains a [Combat Opportunity] Glitch You miss and your opponent gains a [Combat Opportunity]

docs.title: Crippling Shot [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [Attack], [Gun], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Visual]

You take careful aim and target one of your opponent's legs with your shot.

When you use Crippling Shot, if the target is at a [Range] other than the weapon's [Optimal Range], raise the DL by one. Use your weapon's Single Shot [Damage Array] with this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Maximum Damage] and they gain [Movement Impaired] and [Prone] Success You deal [Normal Damage] and they gain [Movement Restricted] Fade You deal [Minimum Damage] and they gain a [Combat Opportunity] Glitch You miss the shot and they gain a [Combat Opportunity]

docs.title: Dual Shot [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [Attack], [Gun], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Visual]

You blast away with two guns, one in each hand.

To use Dual Shot, you must be equipped with two identical pistols or two identical SMGs, one in each hand.

If your weapons have different mods, they can all be used when you make your roll, though the rules on stacking bonuses still apply. Refer to Making a Roll for more information.

You may target the same opponent or two different opponents who are [Nearby] to one another. If at least one target is at a [Range] other than your weapons' [Optimal Range], raise the DL by one.

When you use [Dual Shot], make only one roll and use only one [Damage Array]. If your weapons have a Single Shot [Damage Array] you may use it to calculate damage. If your weapons have a Burst Fire [Damage Array], you may use it instead, but doing so raises the DL by one, and you must declare your intent to use Burst Fire prior to making your roll. Both weapons must use the same mode, Single Shot or Burst Fire.

Outcome Description Cool Success If you had one target, they take double [Maximum Damage] If you had two targets, they each take [Maximum Damage] Success If you had one target, they take [Maximum Damage]If you had two targets they each take [Normal Damage] Fade If you had one target, they take [Normal Damage] and gain a [Combat Opportunity]If you had two targets, they each take [Minimum Damage](/../[Keywords/Keyword_Minimum_Damage)] and one (GM's choice) gains a [Combat Opportunity] Glitch You miss your target(s). One of your targets (GM's choice) gains a [Combat Opportunity]

docs.title: Disable Device [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Hacking [Fine Control], [Physical], [Tools], [Two Hands], [Visual]

You inspect the device's electronic guts and make a calculated choice to snip one of the wires. A second later, the maglock disengages, and the door opens with a hiss.

Disable Device is a hands-on activity that requires you to directly interact with the target's hardware. If you do not have proper [Tools], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success The device is [Disabled] and you gain a [Secret] Success The device is [Disabled] Fade The device is [Disabled] and you have [Vision Impairment] Glitch You fail, have [Vision Impairment], and trigger a [Security Alert]

docs.title: Street Hack [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Hacking [Cyber Rig], [Physical], [Range], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

Your type in the command and your cyber rig spins up, creating an AR overlay of the world around you. By selecting one of the color-coded devices in your field of view, you execute the hack.

To use Street Hack, the device must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success You are an [Admin] Success You are an [Operator] Fade You are an [Operator] and have [Stress] vs. [Security] Glitch You have no access and trigger a [Security Alert]

docs.title: Cybernetic Hack [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Hacking [Cyber Rig], [Physical], [Range], [Wireless], [Two Hands], [Visual]

With the right module installed, peoples' cyberware can be added to your cyber rig's AR overlay. Selecting one of the cybernetic implants in your field of view runs the module and attempts to disable the target.

To use Cybernetic Hack on an opponent, they must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success Choose for their implant to be [Disabled] or [Enabled] and you are an [Admin] Success Their implant is [Disabled] Fade Their implant is [Disabled] and you have [Stress] vs. [Security] Glitch You have no access and trigger a [Security Alert]

docs.title: Droptrip [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Hacking [Cyber Rig], [Datajack], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Unaware]

When you enter an address and jack in, your cyber rig overrides your senses and drops you into the network foam, the lowest layer of the Net. By navigating a digital hallucination, you can gain unauthorized access to the remote system.

Outcome Description Cool Success You are an [Admin] Success You are an [Operator] Fade You are an [Operator] and have [Stress] vs. [Security] Glitch You have no access and trigger a [Security Alert]

docs.title: Read Person [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Insight [Concentrate], [Visual]

You surmise information about a person by studying them, the way they speak, the clothes they're wearing, their facial expressions, and body language.

When you use Read Person, ask the GM to identify a person's current emotional state, immediate goals, or way of thinking. To use Read Person on someone, they must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success GM gives you information and you gain a [Secret] Success GM gives you information Fade GM gives you information and you are [Distracted] Glitch You do not learn any information and you are [Distracted]

docs.title: Sense Lies [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Insight [Concentrate], [Reaction], [Auditory], [Visual]

By listening to the speaker's words and tone and reading their body language, you sense that they are lying.

When someone speaks, you may use a [Reaction] to Sense Lies. If you are unable to see the speaker, raise the DL by one. The scope of Sense Lies is one statement You must roll Sense Lies again each time you want to determine if a statement is a lie.

Outcome Description Cool Success You automatically know if they're lying for the rest of the scene Success You know if they lied Fade You know if they lied and you are [Distracted] Glitch You don't know if they lied and you are [Distracted] and [Confused]

docs.title: Size Up Opponent [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Insight [Concentrate], [Visual]

You perform a mental assessment of an opponent's combat prowess, taking into account all information you can see, such as their weapons, cyberware, armor, insignias or tattoos, and the way they carry themselves.

To use Size Up Opponent on someone, they must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success GM tells you their Threat bonus, Wits and Fort Success GM tells you their Threat bonus Fade GM tells you their Threat bonus and they are [Suspicious] Glitch You do not learn their Threat bonus they are [Suspicious]

docs.title: Dodge [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Insight [Physical], [Reaction], [Visual]

You sense the attack almost before you see it and deftly sidestep and duck out of harms way.

When you are hit by a [Melee][[Attack](/../Keywords/Keyword_Attack)], you may use a [Reaction] to [Dodge].

Outcome Description Cool Success Their [Attack] is [Downgraded] and you [Counterattack] Success Their [Attack] is [Downgraded] Fade Their [Attack] is [Downgraded] and you are [Off Balance] Glitch You take the hit and are [Prone]

docs.title: Coerce [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [Language], [Social], [Vocal]

With threats of damage to income, reputation, or bodily health, you force your victim to comply with your instructions.

If your instructions would put the target or their loved ones in a dangerous situation, raise the DL by one. They will outright refuse instructions that would result in certain death or serious injury.

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Servile] Success They are [Compliant] Fade They are [Compliant] and you have [Stress] vs. Fort Glitch They are not intimidated, their [Attitude] worsens, and they [Break]

docs.title: Mock [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Intimidate [Concentrate], [Language], [Range], [Social], [Vocal]

You hone in on your opponent's insecurities and ruthlessly mock them, undermining their confidence.

To use Mock on an opponent, they must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Distracted] and you are [Inspired] Success They are [Distracted] and their [Attitude] worsens Fade You are both [Distracted] and their [Attitude] worsens Glitch They are unaffected by your words and become [Confident]

docs.title: Frighten [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [Language], [Social], [Visual], [Vocal]

You turn to an individual and look them in the eye. Maybe you say a few words, or you might just let your body language do the talking. Regardless, they are left broken from the brief exchange.

If you use Frighten without speaking, raise the DL by one. You cannot use this trick on someone who is currently suffering from a [Break].

Outcome Description Cool Success They faint and are rendered [Unconscious] Success They [Break] and flee Fade They [Break] and [Attack] you Glitch They are not scared of you and they gain [Confident]

docs.title: Shakedown [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [Language], [Social], [Vocal]

By making veiled threats to your victim, you make them see that it's in their best interests to give you a "gift."

You can suggest what you would like to receive, but the GM is not obligated to have the NPC grant you a specific [Gift.]

Outcome Description Cool Success They give you an expensive [Gift] and a [Secret] Success They give you a regular [Gift] Fade They give you a minor [Gift], their [Attitude] worsens, and they gain [Confident] Glitch They are not intimidated, their [Attitude] worsens, and they [Break]

docs.title: Shred [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Intimidate [Concentrate], [Language], [Range], [Social], [Vocal]

You have perfected the art of the verbal takedown, and your words cut to the bone.

To use Shred on an opponent, they must be [Close] or [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Stunned] and [Shaken] Success They are [Stunned] and their [Attitude] worsens Fade They are [Stunned], their [Attitude] worsens, and you are [Distracted] Glitch They are unaffected by your words and become [Confident]

docs.title: First Aid [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Stabilization DL Medicine [Concentrate], [Physical], [Supplies], [Two Hands], [Visual]

When a friend falls in combat or suffers from another treatable condition, you rush to their side and use your medical knowledge to stabilize them.

If you use First Aid without [Supplies] raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Stabilized] and heal 2 hp + your Medicine bonus Success They are [Stabilized] and gain 2 hp Fade They are [Stabilized] and you have [Stress] vs. [Stabilization DL] Glitch They take 2 damage and gain [Bleeding]

docs.title: Medical Assessment [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Medicine [Concentrate], [Visual]

You provide your medical opinion of a patient, a corpse, or a set of medical records.

When you use Medical Assessment, ask the GM a medical question related to the subject, such as What was the approximate time of death? or Do I know what this disease is or how to cure it? Taking extra time to perform a thorough Medical Assessment can lower the DL by one (GM's discretion.

Outcome Description Cool Success The GM answers the question and you gain a [Secret] Success The GM answers the question Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Glitch You don't know and you are [Confused]

docs.title: Cybernetic Installation [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Medicine [Concentrate], [Location], [Physical]. [Supplies], [Surgical Procedure], [Tools], [Two Hands], [Visual]

Surgery might be more glamorous, but knowing how to install cyberware saves just about as many lives in the sprawl.

You cannot use Cybernetic Installation on someone who is [Bleeding], [Traumatized], or in [Critical Condition]. The patient must be [Stabilized] with First Aid to remove those conditions before Cybernetic Installation can be performed. You may install multiple pieces of cyberware on the same target during the same [Surgical Procedure], but you must roll separately for each one. It does not matter the order you install them in. You cannot use this trick on yourself.

Outcome Description Cool Success The cyberware is installed and they are healed 10 hp Success The cyberware is installed Fade The cyberware is installed and you have [Stress] vs. [Stabilization DL] Glitch They take 10 damage and gain [Bleeding]

docs.title: Surgery [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords By Injury Medicine [Concentrate](/../[Keywords/Keyword_Concentrate)], [Location], [Physical]. [Supplies], [Surgical Procedure], [Tools], [Two Hands], [Visual]

When you pick up your scalpel and enter the surgical theater, it is no exaggeration to say that you save lives.

Refer to the injury's description to determine the DL for using Surgery to treat it and to see if it qualifies for Field Surgery. If you perform Field Surgery, ignore the [Location] keyword on this trick and raise the DL by one. You cannot use Surgery on someone who is [Bleeding], [Traumatized] or in [Critical Condition]. The patient must be [Stabilized] with First Aid to remove those conditions before Surgery can be performed. You may treat multiple injuries on the same target during the same surgical session, but you must roll separately for each one. It does not matter the order you treat them in. You cannot use this trick on yourself.

Outcome Description Cool Success The injury is removed, they gain [Recovering], and they are healed 10 hp Success The injury is removed and they gain [Recovering] Fade The injury is removed and you have [Stress] vs. [Stabilization DL] Glitch They take 10 damage and gain [Bleeding]

docs.title: Melee Strike [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Opposed] Melee [Attack], [Melee], [One Hand], [Physical], [Range], [Visual]

You attack your opponent by viciously swinging or thrusting your melee weapon at them.

To use Melee Strike, your opponent must be [Close].

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Maximum Damage] to them and they are [Prone] Success You deal [Normal Damage] to them Fade You deal [Minimum Damage] to them Glitch You miss and are [Off Balance]

docs.title: Dazzling Strike [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Opposed] Melee [Attack], [Melee], [One Hand], [Physical], [Range], [Visual]

You strike at your opponent's eyes, temporarily obscuring their vision.

To use Dazzling Strike, your opponent must be [Close].

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Minimum Damage] to them and they are [Blinded] Success You deal [Minimum Damage] to them and they are [Visually Impaired] Fade They are [Visually Impaired] Glitch You miss and are [Off Balance]

docs.title: Finishing Move [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Opposed] Melee [Attack], [Move], [Melee], [One Hand], [Physical], [Reaction], [Visual]

You sense your opponent's weakness and use your weapon to finish them.

When an opponent who is [Close] or [Nearby] goes from [Fine] to [Hurting], you can react. You [Move] to the opponent, if they are not already [Close], and roll Finishing Move.

Outcome Description Cool Success They are dead Success You deal [Maximum Damage] Fade You deal [Normal Damage] Glitch You miss and are [Off Balance]

docs.title: Leaping Strike [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Opposed] Melee [Attack], [Melee], [Move], [One Hand], [Physical], [Range], [Visual]

You get a running start, fall from above, or swing in on a rope to perform a mid-air strike.

To use Leaping Strike, first make a basic Athletics roll with a DL of Moderate (14). If you fail, you fall [Prone] and your action ends. Otherwise, you automatically [Move] through the air to a [Nearby] opponent by jumping, swinging, or falling, for example, and roll Leaping Strike.

Outcome Description Cool Success You deal [Maximum Damage] to them and they are [Prone] Success You deal [Normal Damage] to them Fade You deal [Minimum Damage] to them Glitch You miss and fall [Prone]

docs.title: Search [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [Move], [Physical], [Visual]

You move about and study your surroundings for hidden people or objects.

When you use Search, define the scope of your search to the GM, such as I want to search the desk, I want to see if anyone has a weapon, or I want to scan the rooftops for people. If you physically interact with the subject of your search, lower the DL by one. For example, if you're looking for weapons on someone, and you include a physical pat-down as part of your Search, the DL is lowered by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success The GM tells you what you find (if anything) and you learn a [Secret] Success The GM tells you what you find (if anything) Fade The GM tells you what you find (if anything) and you are [Distracted] Glitch You find something unpleasant and you are [Shaken]

docs.title: Dead Eye [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [Gun], [One Hand] [Ranged], [Visual]

You zero in on your opponent and raise your gun. One heartbeat later, you send hot lead their way.

To use Dead Eye on an opponent, they must be [Close] or [Nearby]. If you are wielding a pistol, lower the DL by one.

Outcome Description Cool Success The next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is is an automatic [Cool Success] Success The next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is [Upgraded] Fade Your next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is [Upgraded] and you are [Distracted] Glitch Your next [Gun][[Attack](/../Keywords/Keyword_Attack)] you make on anyone this turn is [Downgraded]

docs.title: Overwatch [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [Auditory], [Concentrate], Language, [Verbal], [Visual]

You survey the combat zone and relay relevant information to your crew, noting the positions and movements of friends, enemies, and civilians.

When you use Overwatch, pick one ally in the same battle as you. The ally must have hands-free wireless comms (headset or cyberware) to benefit from this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success Their next [Attack] is [Upgraded] and they gain 1 [Temporary][[Reaction](/../Keywords/Keyword_Reaction)] Success Their next [Attack] is [Upgraded] Fade Their next [Attack] is [Upgraded] and you are [Distracted] Glitch They get no benefit and you are [Confused]

docs.title: Read Lips [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [Concentrate], [Language], [Range], [Visual]

You focus on a person's lips as they speak and though you cannot hear them, you understand what they are saying.

To use Read Lips, the person speaking must be [Close] or [Nearby]. The scope of Read Lips is one sentence (or a few short sentences.) You must roll Read Lips again each time you want to decipher what the person said.

Outcome Description Cool Success Read Lips is an automatic Success on them for the rest of the scene Success You know what they said Fade You know what they said and they become [Suspicious] Glitch You don't know what they said and they become [Suspicious]

docs.title: Captivate [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Persuade [Attitude], [Physical], [Range], [Social], [Visible]

With a simple change in posture, a strut in your step, or a flick of your hair, you can put on "the look" that makes everyone sit up and take notice.

To use this trick, the opponent(s) must be [Close] or [Nearby]. If there are multiple onlookers, use the highest Wits amongst the [Group].

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Bewildered] and you gain an [Ally] Success They are [Distracted] Fade They are [Distracted] and their [Attitude] worsens Glitch They are not impressed and suffer a [Break]

docs.title: Convince [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Persuade [Attitude], [Language], [Social], [Vocal]

By appealing to the other person's sensibilities, you find a way to convince them to help you or to see things from your point of view.

Outcome Description Cool Success They agree and their [Attitude] improves Success They agree Fade They agree (with some reservations) and they gain [Confident] Glitch They are unconvinced and their [Attitude] worsens

docs.title: Haggle [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Persuade [Attitude], [Language], [Physical], [Social], [Vocal],

With a combination of confidence, market knowledge, and a bit of savvy, you negotiate over the price of goods or services.

In some situations, such as when you purchase from a fixed-price vendor, it is not possible to use Haggle. Attempting to Haggle with someone who has a Hostile [Attitude] towards you automatically fails.

Outcome Description Cool Success You get 20% better price and a [Gift] Success You get 20% better price Fade You get 20% better price and their [Attitude] worsens Glitch You get 20% worse price and their [Attitude] worsens

docs.title: Entertain [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Persuade [Attitude], [Language], [Social], [Vocal]

With a well-timed joke, an unexpected song, or a captivating story, you entertain those around you..

When you use Entertain, you can focus on one person or perform for a larger audience. Describe what you are doing to capture their attention and then roll Entertain.

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Entertained], [Emotional], and your [Ally] Success They are [Entertained] and [Emotional] Fade They are [Entertained] and you have [Stress] vs. Hard (20) Glitch They are not entertained and their [Attitude] worsens

docs.title: Deploy Payload [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Piloting [Concentrate], [Control Deck], [Datajack], [Drone], [Fly], [Range], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

Having piloted your drone to its destination, you carefully position it and deploy its payload.

To use Deploy Payload, describe the spot [Nearby] where you want to drop your payload. This spot is called the mark. For example, I want to place the package in front of the door, or I want to drop the grenade on the truck. If the mark is in a spot that is hard to navigate, the the GM should raise the DL by one. If the mark is extremely hard to navigate, raise the DL by two.

Outcome Description Cool Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby], hit the mark, and are [Inspired] Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby] and hit the mark Fade You [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby] but fail to deploy your payload and gain [Stress] vs. Moderate (14) Glitch You [Fly] the [Drone] [Close], miss the mark, and have a [Bad Memory]

docs.title: Drone Recon [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Piloting [Concentrate], [Control Deck], [Drone], [Fly], [Range], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

Sitting on the side of the road, you remotely pilot a drone and use it to collect intel on your target.

When you use Drone Recon, describe a location [Far] away and state the scope of your search. For example, I want to fly up to the 38th floor and see if I can find the room we're looking for, or I want to do a flyover of the junkyard and see where the gang's guards are stationed. The Difficulty Level is based on the [Security] of the airspace you are entering to perform your search.

Outcome Description Cool Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far], the GM tells you what you find, and you learn a [Secret] Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far] and the GM tells you what you find Fade You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far], the GM tells you what you find, and you have [Stress] vs. [Security] Glitch You [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby], it triggers a [Security Alert], and is [Jammed]

docs.title: Initiate Countermeasures [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [Security] Piloting [Concentrate], [Control Deck], [Datajack], [Drone], [Reaction], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

Your control deck lights up with alerts. Someone is trying to jam your signal. You react by engaging your drone's electronic countermeasures and manually calibrating them to thwart the jam attempt

When your drone is [Jammed], you may use a [Reaction] to Initiate Countermeasures.

Outcome Description Cool Success The [Jammed] condition is removed and you are [Lucky] Success The [Jammed] condition is removed Fade The [Jammed] condition is removed and you have [Stress] vs. [Security] Glitch Your drone is [Jammed] and you gain a [Bad Memory]

docs.title: Manipulate Object [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Piloting [Manipulator Arm], [Concentrate], [Control Deck], [Datajack], [Drone], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

You use your drone's manipulator arm to open doors, use a keypad, or pick up an object, just like you would use your own.

To use Manipulate Object, your [Drone] must be outfitted with a [Manipulator Arm]. When you use Manipulate Object, state the action you want to perform, such as I want use my drone to type the security code into the keypad, or I want my drone to pick up the pistol and put it in its cargo bay.

Outcome Description Cool Success You use the [Manipulator Arm] successfully and you are [Inspired] Success You use the [Manipulator Arm] successfully Fade You use the [Manipulator Arm] successfully and you are [Confused] Glitch You are unsuccessful and [Confused]

docs.title: Strafing Run [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Piloting [Attack], [Control Deck], [Datajack], [Drone], [Fly], [Physical], [Two Hands], [Visual], [Wireless]

You fly your drone low and fast, firing its automatic weapons to rain down lead on your opponents.

To use Strafing Run, your [Drone] must be outfitted with an automatic weapon. You may target up to three opponents with Strafing Run, all of which must be [Nearby] your [Drone] and each other. Use the weapon's Full Auto [Damage Array] with this trick.

Outcome Description Cool Success They take [Normal Damage] and are [Suppressed], and you [Fly] the [Drone] [Far] away Success They take [Normal Damage] and you [Fly] the [Drone] [Far] away Fade They take [Normal Damage] and you [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby] Glitch You miss, [Fly] the [Drone] [Nearby], and are [Out of Ammo]

docs.title: Close Up Magic [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Stealth [Fine Control], [Physical], [Range], [Social], [Two Hands], [Visual]

You dazzle a nearby audience with astounding sleight of hand, making small items vanish and reappear to entertain and bewilder them.

You may use [Close Up Magic] on one person who is [Close] to you or on a [Group] that is [Nearby].

Outcome Description Cool Success They are [Entertained] and [Bewildered] Success They are [Entertained] Fade They are [Entertained] and you are [Distracted] Glitch Your poor execution makes them [Confident]

docs.title: Shadow Target [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [Physical], [Visual]

To be an effective tail, you must leave enough distance between yourself and the target, or else you risk being noticed. At the same time, you must stay close enough that you can keep them in your sights.

To use Shadow Target you must be [Undetected] by the person you are following. The scope of Shadow Target includes the distance from one [Location] to another. Every new destination along the target's route requires another Stealth roll. You may use Shadow Target with any mode of transport, such as on foot, bicycle, or vehicle.

Outcome Description Cool Success You follow them to a [Location] and are [Hidden] Success You follow them to a [Location] and are [Undetected] Fade You follow them to a [Location], are [Undetected] and have [Stress] vs. [Wits] Glitch You lose [Undetected] and their [Attitude] drops one level

docs.title: Sneak [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [Move], [Physical], [Visual]

By moving slowly and quietly and by staying behind cover and out of sight, you sneak to your destination.

To use Sneak, you must be [Undetected] by the people you're avoiding. If multiple observers are present, use the highest Wits amongst them.

Outcome Description Cool Success You [Move] [Nearby] and are [Hidden] Success You [Move] [Nearby] and remain [Undetected] Fade You [Move] somewhere [Nearby], remain [Undetected], and have [Stress] vs. [Wits] Glitch You lose [Undetected] and their [Attitude] drops one level

docs.title: Disappear [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [Physical], [Range], [Reaction], [Visual]

By capitalizing on a sudden distraction, you slip away with not even a whisper.

When one or more observers [Close] to you become [Distracted], you may use a [Reaction] to Disappear.

Outcome Description Cool Success You escape and [Move] [Far] away Success You [Move] [Nearby] and gain [Undetected] Fade You [Move][[Nearby](/../Keywords/Keyword_Nearby)], gain [Undetected] and have [Stress] vs. Moderate (14) Glitch You are seen and their [Attitude] becomes Hostile

docs.title: Pickpocket [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [Fine Control], [Physical], [One Hand], [Range], [Reaction], [Visual]

You exploit a moment of distraction to steal a small item from a person's pocket, wrist, or finger.

When someone who is [Close] to you becomes [Distracted], you may use a [Reaction] to use Pickpocket. You may optionally use this trick to Reverse Pickpocket, which allows you to plant an item on a person rather than steal one from them. Instead of targeting a person, you may also use Pickpocket to discretely lift or drop a [Small Item] from an unattended surface that is [Close], such as a palming a key off a desk or dropping a knife in a waste basket. If multiple observers are present, use the highest Wits among them.

Outcome Description Cool Success You steal a [Small Item] and gain [Inspired] Success You steal a [Small Item] Fade You steal a [Small Item] and they are [Suspicious] Glitch You are caught and their [Attitude] becomes Hostile
